intro: Adenostemma lavenia var. rugosum, commonly known as rough adenostemma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are rough to the touch, giving it its common name, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is often used in traditional medicine and as a source of forage for livestock.
